title: How to separate your Apple media after a divorce | iMore
Divorce lawyers warn warring couples to unsync iPhones |
description: 15-06-2018 Married couples often share an Apple ID or iCloud account, but doing so can give an ex-partner access to emails, messages, photos, or locational data without their spouse even knowing. Suzanne...

title: Divorce Story on Apple Podcasts
description: 03-03-2020 Divorce Story would have been a great source of information, especially late at night. I found myself nodding, smiling, reliving the highs, pain and despair I felt. Everyone has their own unique story, talking, listening and sharing stories definitely helps, so thank you. Divorce is very hard emotionally & financially. So is navigating the new you.

title: How can I divorce a phone from my ex and change the Apple ID? -
description: 16-02-2015 Is there anyway I can divorce this phone from my ex, sign it in under my own apple id, download the games he liked the best under my nickel, and let my kid play his games? He already doesn't understand what's going on, I'd like to at least give him back his favorite games... thanks, frustrated momma

title: Divorce App on the App Store - iTunes - Apple
description: 29-08-2010 The Divorce App is based on Dr. Woliver's book Mango Season Doesn't Last Forever: A Guide to Helping Children Cope with Divorce. Dr. Woliver brings 25 years of experience working with children of divorce. The Divorce App helps you ensure that your child not only survives the divorce, but also grows positively from the experience.

title: Divorcing and needing to separate Apple ID : apple
description: Assuming it's an Apple Music account, it's attached to the Apple ID that owns it. You can try to do a family account, but I doubt that's ideal given the divorce. Same for music you purchased. If it was purchased on your Apple ID, it's yours and no one elses. But iTunes is DRM free, so you can probably just send her all of the files and let her ...

title: Splitting a shared Apple ID/iCloud account amongst two or more
description: 03-11-2015 Splitting a shared Apple ID/iCloud account amongst two or more users. 3 November 2015, 04:54. Once upon a time people would create a single Apple ID and share it amongst family and friends. In other words, EVERYBODY logged into their iPhone or iPad using the same Apple ID.

title: What to do when breaking up a shared Apple ID account | Macworld
description: Apples cloud services (iTunes, iCloud, etc.) require you to create an Apple ID, which is essentially your key to access. Each person using Apples services should have a unique Apple ID, but ...

title: The problem with Apple IDs | Macworld
description: You use your Apple ID to buy music, movies, apps, and more from the iTunes Store. But Senior Contributor Kirk McElhearn says that Apple IDs are significantly flawed, and have been for a long while.

title: How a Divorcing Spouse Can Spy on You Using Your iPhone
description: In a divorce, iMessage coupled with Message Forwarding could be used by one spouse to intercept the other spouses messages. All that is needed is an Apple product to serve as the remote device for purposes of monitoring the targets messages and the targets Apple ID and password.
